title: 9 Luxurious Hotels for Your Next Caribbean Vacation
description: Stay at one of these luxurious resorts on your next Caribbean vacation. They're not cheap, but good deals are out there — and some are bookable with points.
author: Ramsey Qubein
excerpt: Stay at one of these luxurious resorts on your next Caribbean vacation. They're not cheap, but good deals are out there — and some are bookable with points.
text: Whether you’re looking for a quick getaway or a long-awaited trip to the sunny islands, choosing a high-end hotel can elevate your entire Caribbean vacation. These stays typically come with a higher price tag, but often include food, drinks and first-rate amenities that add exceptional value. And if you use points to cover some or all of your trip, you can significantly lower your out-of-pocket costs.To give you a sense of the cost, we checked prices for the night of Dec. 1, 2025. Here are some of the region’s most luxe resorts.1. Hotel Mousai Cancun(Photo courtesy of Preferred Hotels & Resorts)Part of the Preferred Hotels & Resorts group, Hotel Mousai Cancun is an adults-only all-inclusive getaway facing the shoreline. It has a beautiful pool near the lobby and another on the roof. Guests also have full access to the restaurants and pools at the Garza Blanca sibling property next door. By joining Tafer Rewards, you can book a room for $410 or get the all-inclusive rate for $554, which can significantly reduce the overall costs by including all of your food and beverage expenses. You can also redeem Choice Privileges points to stay at a Preferred Hotels property. Cardholders who earn American Express Membership Rewards, Capital One Miles or Citi ThankYou points can transfer their points to Choice.2. Embassy Suites by Hilton Aruba Resort(Photo courtesy of Hilton) The Embassy Suites by Hilton Aruba Resort is as family-friendly as it gets. Stays come with a cooked-to-order breakfast and evening happy hour with snacks and cocktails. All rooms here are two-room suites with a small kitchenette, a living room with a sofa bed and a furnished balcony. You won't have to pay for breakfast or book an extra room for the kids, and the resort has a lovely pool and tunnel for direct beach access. With all of these inclusions, the starting $409 nightly rates can be a good deal. You can also book with Hilton rewards, but at 181,000 points per night, it's a low-value redemption.⭐️ Nerds Give This Hotel Card Rare 5-Star RatingPowerhouse travel card now offering its best deal of the year: Earn 5 free nights! ⏳ 3. Hyatt Ziva Rose Hall, Jamaica(Photo courtesy of Hyatt) Hyatt Ziva is a family-focused brand within World of Hyatt’s all-inclusive collection. Kids can splash in the numerous pools and water play areas or at the sandy beach. When the sun sets, the number of dining options is vast, including popular choices like Italian, French, Jamaican barbecue and Asian fusion. World of Hyatt members can score an all-inclusive deal for the whole family (with food and beverages covered) for as low as $367 per night. Award stays start at 35,000 points per night.4. Impression Isla Mujeres by Secrets, Mexico(Photo courtesy of Hyatt) Another resort that belongs to the World of Hyatt all-inclusive brand portfolio, Impression Isla Mujeres by Secrets offers dramatic views from its expansive hotel suites plus an infinity pool. It also features a waterslide and a swim-up bar, as well as incredible dining options that do not cost anything extra. Another popular activity is snorkeling along the world’s second-largest coral reef. Guests can also scuba dive past sunken sculptures from the Cancun Underwater Museum of Art. While the starting rate for World of Hyatt members is a lofty $1,087, the quality and seclusion of this upscale all-inclusive, all-suite resort outmatch almost all others in the region. Award stays start at 42,000 points per night.5. InterContinental Dominica Cabrits Resort & Spa(Photo courtesy of IHG)Dominica is one of the most lush islands in the Caribbean and offers plenty to do for those who enjoy the outdoors. The enormous swimming pools here face the ocean, and there's a swim-up bar.The hotel is part of IHG One Rewards, which means guests can earn or redeem valuable points when they visit. If you have an IHG credit card that you use to pay for the stay, you could earn even more points to use on your next vacation. IHG One Rewards members can book a night starting at $421, or 77,000 points.6. Hard Rock Hotel Punta Cana(Photo courtesy of Hard Rock Hotels) Pack your swimsuit and sign up for Hard Rock’s new loyalty program to take advantage of its redemptions and perks. Plus, this resort is all-inclusive (well, except for the casino and spa), and guests can eat and drink as much as they like. Even the gratuities are included.If you are not interested in the Hard Rock loyalty program, consider making your reservation with a travel agent who can secure extra perks on your behalf or via an online travel agency such as Orbitz, where you can earn Orbucks in its loyalty program. The all-inclusive rate here packs in all kinds of extra perks and starts at $483.7. Sandals Dunn’s River Ocho Rios, Jamaica(Photo courtesy of Sandals)Sandals is famous for its all-inclusive resorts. This Sandals location has a dozen restaurants, and there is also a dine-around program in which guests can visit local restaurants to get a regional experience included in the cost. Back at the resort, glamorous swimming pools and a sprawling beach add to the fun. A minimum three-night stay is required here during the December dates we checked, with the rate below reflecting the cost of three nights. For all of the inclusions here, guests can eat, drink and play for less than $1,000 per night in paradise.8. Royalton CHIC Antigua(Photo courtesy of Marriott)This adults-only all-inclusive resort is part of the Marriott Bonvoy loyalty program. It means that travelers can earn or redeem points during their stay, packing in extra value during a vacation. This resort is part of Autograph Collection, one of Marriott’s many brands. The resort has a stunning beachfront location, numerous pools and tasty dining. With all food and beverages included, the $685 nightly rate for two people can be a good value. If you paid with rewards, it would be 88,000 points.9. Sheraton Puerto Rico Resort & Casino(Photo courtesy of Marriott)The Sheraton Puerto Rico Resort & Casino is adjacent to the convention center as well as Distrito T-Mobile, a popular shopping center with restaurants, shops and a cinema.
